 007: # "cimport" is used to import special compile-time information
 008: # about the numpy module (this is stored in a file numpy.pxd which is
 009: # currently part of the Cython distribution).
 010: cimport numpy as np
 011: 
 012: # It's necessary to call "import_array" if you use any part of the
 013: # numpy PyArray_* API. From Cython 3, accessing attributes like
 014: # ".shape" on a typed Numpy array use this API. Therefore we recommend
 015: # always calling "import_array" whenever you "cimport numpy"

      values[2] = PyTuple_GET_ITEM(__pyx_args, 2);
      values[3] = PyTuple_GET_ITEM(__pyx_args, 3);

 109:     # @timer
+110:     def GetSegmentLength(self, altitude, elevation):
/* Python wrapper */
static PyObject *__pyx_pw_7pomerol_19multiple_scattering_18MultipleScattering_3GetSegmentLength(PyObject *__pyx_self, PyObject *__pyx_args, PyObject *__pyx_kwds); /*proto*/
static char __pyx_doc_7pomerol_19multiple_scattering_18MultipleScattering_2GetSegmentLength[] = "Compute the length of the path along one segment given its starting altitude and elevation.\n        Compute atmospheric cross sections along the potential path which weigths the random probability to be scattered at one point.\n        Return the segment length.";
static PyMethodDef __pyx_mdef_7pomerol_19multiple_scattering_18MultipleScattering_3GetSegmentLength = {"GetSegmentLength", (PyCFunction)(void*)(PyCFunctionWithKeywords)__pyx_pw_7pomerol_19multiple_scattering_18MultipleScattering_3GetSegmentLength, METH_VARARGS|METH_KEYWORDS, __pyx_doc_7pomerol_19multiple_scattering_18MultipleScattering_2GetSegmentLength};

/* Python wrapper */

 164:         #For bin number n, compute the probability that scattering does not happen before on the segment, i.e. probability that the ray reaches bin n. (1-p(-1)) * ((1-p(-2))) * ... * ((1-p(-n)))

+582:     def GetRayStocksParameters(self, ray_id):
/* Python wrapper */
static PyObject *__pyx_pw_7pomerol_19multiple_scattering_18MultipleScattering_23GetRayStocksParameters(PyObject *__pyx_self, PyObject *__pyx_args, PyObject *__pyx_kwds); /*proto*/
